result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Esra Kanas

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:00 am cases 21CF1169, 22CF491, 22CF625 called. Defendant Esra Kanas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Esra Kanas.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Jill Short, Chuukese interpreter, appears via video and is sworn and interprets.  Attorney Rivard gives a summary of the cases and advises they are close to an agreement but defense will need an interpreter to discuss the plea paperwork. A plea hearing is scheduled for 12/21/22 at 10:00 am. 
Adjourned: 9:17 am.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:45 AM Cases called: 21CF1169, 22CF491 & 22CF625 Defendant Esra Kanas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Esra Kanas.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Jill Short, Chuukese Interpreter, appeared via Zoom, is sworn and interprets. 
Defendant has reviewed the Information in each case. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas.  Defense would like a status conference. 
STC: 10/19/22 at 9am
(Interpreter scheduled for 8:45am for time for client to speak with Defense counsel)
Notice of Hearing to Defendant. USPS indicates Attempted- Not Known; Return to sender; Unable to forward.
Adding to the probable cause portion of the complaint.

2:35 PM Cases called: 21CF1169, 22CF491 & 22CF625. Defendant Esra Kanas in court.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fran Rivard appeared for Esra Kanas. This is the date and time set for the Preliminary Hearing. Jill Short, Chuukese Interpreter, appears via Zoom video. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 21CF1169 & 22CF491 and Court accepts waiver. 

All cases are referred to Br. 4 for scheduling an arraignment. (Off record briefly to schedule) Arraignment: 07/21/22 at 8:45am (a meeting with the interpreter is set for 07/21/22 at 8:15am in the Clerk of Court Zoom breakout room)

2:50pm

Conditions:
No contact with R.R. (in any way) or their residence.
Not to be in possession of knives excluding kitchen use utensils.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Includes 21CF1169, 22CF491)
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:16 AM cases 22CF625, 22CF491, 21CF1169 called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Esra Kanas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Esra Kanas. Jill Short, Chuukese Interpreter, is sworn and interprets. 
In 22CF625:  Defense waives reading. State argues for $5,000 cash bond citing new criminal charges and numerous missed appearances. Defense argues against cash bond. 
Court orders cash bond forfeited in 21CF1169 and orders a $1,500 cash bond on new file and  21CF1169 
Defense requests a preliminary hearing. A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 6/14/22 at 2:30 PM. Interpreter confirms they are available at that date and time. 
Adjourned: 10:33 AM

of Amended Complaint (Added to and Incorporated with Original Complaint).
The Defendant's correct legal name is Esra Kanas

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:30 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ezra Kanas appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Ezra Kanas.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
State addresses if the defendant needs an interpreter. Defendant does need a Chuukese interpreter.
Court advises this case will be scheduled to ride along with defendant's other pending case.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on May 23, 2022 at 2:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am in Branch 4.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

ADDRESS INFO for Ezra Kanas

Prior: 1105 Bellevue Ave, Eau Claire, WI 54703
